definition: variant of 飄盪|飘荡[piao1 dang4]
to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond
variant of 燙|烫[tang4]/variant of 趟[tang4]

sentences.english: I must down to the seas again, to the vagrant gypsy life.
sentences.chinese: 我必须再度出航，前往吉普赛式的漂荡。

sentences.english: The ball drifted on the water.
A tiny fishing boat was drifting slowly along.
sentences.chinese: 一条小渔船正慢慢向前漂荡。

sentences.english: Clouds float in the sky and a creek flows past the town.
sentences.chinese: 云彩在蓝天漂荡，小溪流过小镇。

sentences.english: The ball drifted on the water.
sentences.chinese: 那只皮球在水面上漂荡。

sentences.english: Peter likes nothing better than going to the coast and messing about in his boat.
sentences.chinese: 彼得最喜欢去海边，毫无目的地让船在海中漂荡。

sentences.english: Me here at last on the ground, You in mid-air.
sentences.chinese: 我终于躺在地上，你还在空中漂荡。

definition: to drift/to wave/to float on the waves/to flutter in the wind
to float/to hover/also written 漂浮
to drift (in the tide)/to rove/to lead a wandering existence/drifter/wanderer
to float/to hover/to drift (also fig., to lead a wandering life)/to rove/showy/superficial
to ripple/to undulate/also written 蕩漾|荡漾
